text: you know what I feel like doesn't really
get its due well actually maybe it is
getting its dude these days
it's cauliflower it's one of my favorite
vegetables I think it's coming into its
own and today I'm gonna help it along by
roasting it with a delicious anchovy hot
pepper flake paste and some salmon for a
great one-pan meal the first thing you
want to do is cut up your cauliflower
into florets kind of big because it's
gonna roast in the oven at 450 and while
it seems sort of chunky and hearty it
actually cooks pretty quickly and
transfer those to a large bowl I cannot
actually get enough roasted cauliflower
it's so sweet and delicious you're gonna
love it too and it's a really nice match
for salmon to flavor the whole dish
you're gonna make a paste now it's an
anchovy garlic paste you might be
thinking I hate anchovies well you could
leave the anchovies out if you wanted to
or you could give it a try and see how
fantastic they are and what great flavor
they add it's kind of up to you but I
say do it a quarter teaspoon of red
pepper flakes four large cloves of
garlic and then between two and four
anchovies I am going for four and often
when you're cooking with them like this
the flavor just sort of dissolves into
everything else and become something
that's not really traceable but adds a
lot of depth of flavor don't forget a
little bit of salt here the salt is
working as an abrasive here and it
breaks down the anchovy and garlic
really quickly start off by chopping and
then once you've really got it sort of
minced you can use the side of your
knife to sort of mash it into the board
I do suggest that if you're mashing
garlic or slicing onions or anything
like that you might want to use a
separate board that you never use for
cutting up fruit because try as you
might the garlic or onion flavor never
fully comes out until you slice an
orange on that same board and then it
goes right into the orange so I don't
generally suggest having more than one
of anything but more than
one cutting board isn't so bad when
you've gotten it as fine as possible you
can add your anchovy mixture to your
cauliflower throw that in with your
cauliflower and then add some oil I'm
gonna use four tablespoons of olive oil
you could use a combination of two
tablespoons olive oil and two
tablespoons oil from the anchovies if
you really were going crazy for anchovy
have your oven preheating to 450 degrees
and this is gonna pre roast before you
add your salmon put it onto a rimmed
baking sheet spread this out on the
baking sheet and get it into the oven
for about 15 minutes to start cooking
these guys are about halfway cooked you
can add your salmon for pieces of
skinless salmon just push the
cauliflower out of the way you're gonna
put your salmon in the center salt and
pepper
and then a little bit of lemon for
flavor I have some lemon wheels that I
cut into half and then back into the
oven for about 15 minutes or until the
fish is cooked to your liking and just
like that it is done I love a sheet pan
supper I can't even tell you if I could
cook everything on one sheet pan I would
he wanted to add some green vegetable to
this you could or a little bit of salad
but I think that this is really really
nice all on its own a little bit of
fresh lemon might be nice you never have
too much lemon and there you have it
it's cauliflower and salmon roasted
together
for your enjoyment
first it is good
